data: Refer to STOP-Bang Questionnaire: Screening Tool for OSA and Prediction of Baseline and Postoperative Risk from OSA Scoring System
Consider Baseline Risk and Postoperative Risk Indicators for determination of monitoring and disposition
Patient must stay for at least 1 hour after last respiratory event on ROOM AIR (unless being transferred to a monitored bed)
Patient must stay for at least 1 hour after standard CSSU discharge criteria met
Final decision regarding appropriate postoperative disposition made by Anesthesiologist
Require monitored bed: Continuous pulse oximetry and possibility of early nursing intervention

Baseline Risk:  - Baseline Risk is LOW (2-3) ' discharge home or to standard ward if all above criteria met (no post-op risk indicators)  - Baseline Risk is MODERATE/INCREASED (4) ' ward or CSSU upon assessment by attending anesthesiologist  - Baseline Risk is HIGH/SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASED (5-6) ' monitored bed required
Patient may use Home Settings, apply if modified aldrete score less than 8 or sleeping
Unless contraindicated by surgeon / cardiologist, place patient in semi-fowler or lateral position
Reason: to be applied continuously, Please right click to modify and specify NIPPV / BiPAP settings
Reason: to be applied nocturnally, Please right click to modify and specify NIPPV / BiPAP settings
Reason: to be applied PRN respiratory distress, Please right click to modify and specify NIPPV / BiPAP settings
Reason: to be applied all the time except for meals, Please right click to modify and specify NIPPV / BiPAP settings
Reason for follow-up: To ensure appropriate NIPPV alarms are active and to assess effectiveness of NIPPV / BiPAP therapy
Reason for Consult: assessment and treatment
Referral to Clinic Not Using CST Cerner
Within 4 Weeks, Paper Referral, complete and submit UBC Sleep Disorders Clinic Referral Form, Reason for referral: suspected sleep apnea
Patient to follow up with family provider for sleep disorder referral
